titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Duke University Marching Band (DUMB) records, 1958-1978 and undated UA.31.07.0006
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Mary Samouelian; machine-readable finding aid created by: Mary Samouelian

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-03-23 11:27:18 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: In existence since the early 1900s, the Duke University Marching Band (DUMB) is an integral part of Duke University sports, providing music and vocal support to university games such as football and basketball. Materials in the collection include administrative records (of the DUMB organization), correspondence, handbooks, game schedules, flyers, the DUMB newsletter, drum heads from the 1958 Orange Bowl and 1961 Cotton Bowl football games, and rosters of alumni.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: Copyright for Official University records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Duke University Marching Band (DUMB) Records, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Duke University Marching Band (DUMB) records were received by the University Archives as a transfer in 1973, 1976, and 2017.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions 73-67, 76-106 were merged into one collection, described in this finding aid.
Accession UA2017-0050 added by Tracy M. Jackson, September 2017.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: In existence since the early 1900's, the Duke University Marching Band (DUMB) is an integral part of Duke University sports, providing music and vocal support to university games such as football and basketball. Playing home games, close out-of-town games and any Bowl games, DUMB has established a reputation for performing creative and highly entertaining halftime shows.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Materials in the collection include administrative records (of the organization), correspondence, handbooks, game schedules, flyers, the DUMB newsletter, a signed drum head from the 1958 Orange Bowl football games, a drum head from the 1961 Cotton Bowl football game, and rosters of alumni.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Paul Bryan Papers, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

did.unittitle: Duke University Marching Band in the News, 1958-1978 and undated
Game Schedules and Information, 1970-1973 and undated

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Drum head used in the 1958 Orange Bowl game in Miami, FL, between Duke University and the University of Oklahoma. The drum head was ruptured during practice and signed by members of the drum corps.
